fields.title: Data Inventory
fields.description: This section is simply identifying the types of data and the data fields that need to be de-identified.
fields.help_tip: The names of the columns will be cross-referenced with a database of risky column name.

fields.question: Do any fields contain unique identifiers?
fields.help_tip: A unique identifier is a piece of information assigned to an individual that is distinct and specific to them. Examples of a unique identifier are customer ID, membership number or account number.

fields.question: Please select all the geographic attributes present in dataset?
fields.help_tip: Fields that might indicate geographic locations like addresses, postal codes, or city names.

fields.question: Please select all the time related information present in dataset?
fields.help_tip: Time related information includes attributes that record when events occurred or when data points were collected.

fields.question: Please select all the information related to financial transactions present in dataset?
fields.help_tip: Fields related to financial transactions, insurance information, billing records, etc.

fields.question: Please select all the demographic information present in dataset?
fields.help_tip: Fields such as age, gender, ethnicity, etc.

fields.question: Are there any free-text or narrative fields?
fields.help_tip: Fields that might contain unstructured or semi-structured data, such as medical notes or comments.
